data.event: In 1262, Richard de Winton was granted 7 acres (28,000 m2) of land by former landowner, Thomas Grelley, at a rate of one shilling and two pence (1s 2d or 6p) per year.

event.title: grew over the next few decades

data.event: These 7 acres (28,000 m2) grew over the next few decades to become the hamlet of Winton.
